guardians.model.entities

Class DateProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • guardians.model.entities.DateProvider

  • public class DateProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will supply with dates, some of the valid and some of them invalid. Its purpose is to allow other Test classes to easily have dates to test, and not have to hard-code them in every single test. The way in which this class is intended to be used is as follows: DateProvider myDateProvider = new DateProvider(); Integer day, month, year; while (myDateProvider.moveToNext()) { day = myDateProvider.getDay(); month = myDateProvider.getMonth(); year = myDateProvider.getYear(); if (myDateProvider.isValidDate()) { // Do something } else { // Do something else } }
    Author:
    miggoncan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.Integer[][] data
      The data array will contain an entry for each date to be provided The first int will be the day, the second one will be the month, the third one will be the year, and the fourth and last one will be 1 if the date is valid or 0 if invalid
